ticket.title: Event-family convergence and replay-equivalence gates for work lifecycle

tickets.reason: Requires projection-authority runtime surface for parity/replay validation.
Authority-binding contract must be present before semantic parity is evaluated.

in_scope: Implement explicit mapping/parity checks between underscore daemon events, dotted reducer events, and protobuf typed events.
Validate state/rationale/sequence/actor equivalence across mapped events.
Add promotion gate that blocks when parity or replay-equivalence fails.
Emit structured defects with offending event IDs and mapping class on parity failure.
out_of_scope: Changing FAC policy semantics unrelated to event mapping fidelity.
Replacing kernel event schema families outright in this ticket.

steps: Define canonical mapping matrix for all work lifecycle transitions.
Implement dual-read/dual-validate gate checks in migration path.
Add replay tests with restart and duplicate-delivery fault injection.
Wire parity failure output to defect recording and promotion block logic.
Run cargo fmt --all && cargo clippy --workspace --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings && cargo test --workspace.

criteria: Parity checks cover underscore, dotted, and protobuf lifecycle events.
Replay-equivalence holds with no duplicate external side-effects.
Promotion is blocked automatically on unresolved parity defects.

notes.security: Semantic drift across event families is treated as a safety fault, not advisory telemetry.
notes.verification: Include deterministic replay suites with idempotency assertions.
